qas.question: What could we monitor electronically that could help inform new methods of wood protection?
Development in the wood manufacturing industry include using lignin to make what substance?
Instead of rubber, what important part of a car might someday be replaced by components of wood?
What material might be developed from wood that could make clothes that resist wear and tear?
In addition to extracting components from wood, what might scientist do by adding components, for example, to make innovative products?

context: Further developments include new lignin <a1_0>glue<a1_0/> applications, recyclable food packaging, rubber <a2_0>tire<a2_0/> replacement applications, anti-bacterial medical agents, and <a3_0>high strength fabrics<a3_0/> or composites. As scientists and engineers further learn and develop new techniques to extract various components from wood, or alternatively to <a4_0>modify wood<a4_0/>, for example by adding components to wood, new more advanced products will appear on the marketplace. <a0_0>Moisture content<a0_0/> electronic monitoring can also enhance next generation wood protection.
